This information shall not be modified in content and then presented as official government material. In no event shall NOAA/ESRL Global Systems Division be liable to you or to any third party for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, special or exemplary damages or lost profit resulting from any use or misuse of this data. This server is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week, however this server is not operational and is not maintained 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Timely delivery of data and products from this server through the Internet is not guaranteed. Any references or links from the Global Systems Division's web server to any non-Federal Government Web sites do not imply endorsement of any particular product, service, organization, company, information provider, or content. We are not responsible for the contents of any "off-site" web pages referenced from the Global Systems Division servers.

title: forum
summary: WRF-Chem email list A new email group for the WRF-Chem user community: https://list.woc.noaa.gov/cgi-bin/mailman/listinfo/wrf-chem-discussions The objectives of this email list (WRF-Chem discussions) are to reach out to the large worldwide WRF-Chem users community for important announcements and updates, to facilitate exchange of ideas and ongoing model developments among the users, and to foster collaboration among different research groups. Interested users can subscribe to the email group via the provided link. When you fill in the form, please don’t forget to indicate your affiliation, so we can get better idea about the users community. All members of the email list will be able to send emails to the entire WRF-Chem discussions group. However, all the email need to be approved by moderators before sending out to the entire group in order to eliminate spam. For any email list questions, please feel free to contact us via wrfchemhelp.gsd@noaa.gov

title: forum
summary: WRF-Chem Forum A New Forum for the WRF-Chem User Community: https://forum.mmm.ucar.edu/ Interested users can submit their questions to the forum via the provided link. No account is needed to browse the forum, but in order to post a new topic or a reply, it will be necessary to create an account - which should only take a minute, and involves simply choosing a username and password. The forum is divided into primary topics and subtopics. Please take care to read the introduction and to post to the correct subtopic. At the bottom of the main forum page, you will also find places to post job/position announcements, conference announcements, and to provide forum feedback. Scoll down the forum page and look for the WRF-Chem Support for different topics: Emissions, Gas Chemistry and KPP, Aerosols, and Chemistry-meteorology Interactions.
